prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole** The final shape is a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole through its center. The prism has a flat top and bottom, and the cylindrical hole is centered along the length of the prism. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of 0.5 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0622, 0.0218] For the first face of the sketch, create the following loop: - arc_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.1648], Mid Point [0.0991, 0.0], End Point [0.2912, 0.0103] - line_1: Start Point [0.2912, 0.0103], End Point [0.7164, 0.3646] - arc_2: Start Point [0.7164, 0.3646], Mid Point [0.7332, 0.4896], End Point [0.6101, 0.517] - line_2: Start Point [0.6101, 0.517], End Point [0.3731, 0.3802] - arc_3: Start Point [0.3731, 0.3802], Mid Point [0.3109, 0.3802], End Point [0.2798, 0.4341] - line_3: Start Point [0.2798, 0.4341], End Point [0.2798, 0.6312] - arc_4: Start Point [0.2798, 0.6312], Mid Point [0.2051, 0.7226], End Point [0.1006, 0.6675] - line_4: Start Point [0.1006, 0.6675], End Point [0.0, 0.1648] The first face contains 1 loop with 4 lines and 4 arcs. For the second face of the sketch, create the following loop: - circle_1: Center [0.1866, 0.1648], Radius 0.0622 For the third face of the sketch, create the following loop: - circle_1: Center [0.1866, 0.6312], Radius 0.0466 For the fourth face of the sketch, create the following loop: - circle_1: Center [0.6567, 0.4363], Radius 0.0466 Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.7332. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.0622 - extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0 - sketch_scale: 0.7332 - operation: Create a new solid body</description>

<description>**Part 1: A cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. It has a hole in the center of the top.** The first part is a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. It has a hole in the center of the top. 1. **Create a new coordinate system:** - The euler angles are [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] degrees, and the translation vector is [0.0, 0.0184, 0.0]. 2. **Draw the 2D sketch:** - The 2D sketch is drawn on a plane defined by the coordinate system. - The sketch consists of one face (face_1). 3. **Draw the curves:** - Loop_1 consists of 4 arcs: - Arc_1 starts at [0.1373, 0.2561], has a midpoint at [0.3431, 0.201], and ends at [0.4939, 0.0502]. - Arc_2 starts at [0.4939, 0.0502], has a midpoint at [0.6814, 0.0], and ends at [0.7316, 0.1875]. - Arc_3 starts at [0.7316, 0.1875], has a midpoint at [0.4804, 0.4387], and ends at [0.1373, 0.5306]. - Arc_4 starts at [0.1373, 0.5306], has a midpoint at [0.0, 0.3934], and ends at [0.1373, 0.2561]. - Loop_2 consists of 1 circle: - Circle_1 has a center at [0.1373, 0.3934] and a radius of 0.0458. 4. **Create loops and faces:** - Loop_1 is a closed loop consisting of 4 arcs. - Loop_2 is a closed loop consisting of 1 circle. - Face_1 is the outer face, and it consists of Loop_1. 5. **Scale the 2D sketch:** - Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.7316. 6. **Transform the 2D sketch into 3D:** - The euler angles are [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] degrees, and the translation vector is [0.0, 0.0184, 0.0]. 7. **Extrude the 2D sketch:** - Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.1162 units towards the normal and 0 units towards the opposite direction of normals. - This will create a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side which has a hole in the center of the top. - The height of this part is 0.1162 units, the width is 0.7316 units, and the length is also 0.7316 units.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.** **Step 1: Create a new coordinate system** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] **Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system** Start by drawing a rectangle as a face on the XY plane of the coordinate system. - Loop 1: Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0312, 0.0] - Loop 1: Line 2: Start Point [0.0312, 0.0], End Point [0.0312, 0.0312] - Loop 1: Line 3: Start Point [0.0312, 0.0312], End Point [0.0, 0.0312] - Loop 1: Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0312], End Point [0.0, 0.0] **Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch using the sketch_scale scaling parameter** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.0312. **Step 4: Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector.** Apply the coordinate system properties from Step 1 to the 2D sketch. **Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model** Extrude the 2D sketch along the negative Z-axis by 0.0312 units. Set the extrusion depth towards the normal as 0.0 units and the extrusion depth opposite the normal as 0.75 units. **Part 2: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side.** **Step 1: Create a new coordinate system** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0312] **Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system** Start by drawing a rectangle as a face on the XY plane of the coordinate system. - Loop 1: Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0312, 0.0] - Loop 1: Line 2: Start Point [0.0312, 0.0], End Point [0.0312, 0.0312] - Loop 1: Line 3: Start Point [0.0312, 0.0312], End Point [0.0, 0.0312] - Loop 1: Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0312], End Point [0.0, 0.0] **Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch using the sketch_scale scaling parameter** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.0312. **Step 4: Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector.** Apply the coordinate system properties from Step 1 to the 2D sketch. **Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model** Extrude the 2D sketch along the negative Y-axis by 0.0156 units. Set the extrusion depth towards the normal as 0.0 units and the extrusion depth opposite the normal as 0.0156 units.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Creating the Base Prism Construct a rectangular prism. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, and 0.0, and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.1166]. For the sketch, create a new face and draw a rectangle with four lines. The first line should start at [0.0, 0.0] and end at [0.6281, 0.0]. The second line starts at [0.6281, 0.0] and ends at [0.6281, 0.4711]. The third line begins at [0.6281, 0.4711] and ends at [0.0, 0.4711]. The last line starts at [0.0, 0.4711] and returns to [0.0, 0.0]. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.6281. Extrude the scaled sketch by a depth of 0.1166 towards the normal and 0.0 towards the opposite direction of the normal. Part 2: Adding the Cylindrical Holes Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, and 0.0, and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.1166]. For the sketch, create a new face and draw a rectangle with four lines, as in Part 1. On this same face, draw three circles for loops (loop\\_2, loop\\_3, loop\\_4). The circles should have their centers at [0.2019, 0.2478], [0.4335, 0.2499], and [0.5661, 0.2478], and all have a radius of 0.0112. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.6281. Extrude the scaled sketch by a depth of 0.0718 towards the normal and 0.0 towards the opposite direction of the normal. Perform a CutFeatureOperation with the current part and the previous part. Part 3: Building the Triangular Component Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, and 0.0, and a translation vector of [0.0561, 0.1009, 0.1166]. For the sketch, create three faces: - Face 1: Draw a circle with its center at [0.1458, 0.1458] and a radius of 0.1458. - Face 2: Draw a circle with its center at [0.377, 0.1458] and a radius of 0.0785. - Face 3: Draw a circle with its center at [0.5096, 0.1458] and a radius of 0.0449. On each face, draw a smaller circle at the center with a radius of 0.0112. Scale the entire sketch by 0.5545. Perform a NewBodyFeatureOperation with the current part. Extrude the scaled sketch by a depth of 0.0314 towards the normal and 0.0 towards the opposite direction of the normal. Part 4: Creating the Cylindrical Object Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, and 0.0, and a translation vector of [0.7276, 0.2913, 0.1166]. For the sketch, create a new face and draw a circle with its center at [0.0112, 0.0112] and a radius of 0.0112. Extrude the sketch by a depth of 0.2692 towards the normal and 0.0 towards the opposite direction of the normal. Perform a NewBodyFeatureOperation with the current part. With these steps, this CAD model assembly should be complete.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Create the base of the cylindrical object Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the Euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. This will ensure that our sketch is aligned with the global coordinate system. Next, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Within the sketch, create two concentric circles, denoted as circle\\_1, with the following properties: * Circle 1: + Center: [0.375, 0.375] + Radius: 0.375 * Circle 2: + Center: [0.375, 0.375] + Radius: 0.3033 Each circle forms a separate face in the sketch: face\\_1 consists of circle\\_1 and face\\_2 consists of circle\\_2. Additionally, create a third concentric circle indicated as circle\\_3 with these properties: * Circle 3: + Center: [0.375, 0.375] + Radius: 0.2757 And incorporate this into face\\_1 as well. The object we are creating is cylindrical with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The concentric circles help ensure proper scaling when creating the 3D model from this 2D sketch. Now, scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75 using the `sketch_scale` parameter. This will create a scaled 2D sketch. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model, using an extrusion depth of 0.07 along the positive Z-axis. The negative direction depth should be 0.0 to keep the other side flat. Part 2 Instructions Create the tapered ring of the cylindrical object Create a new coordinate system with the Euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector set to [0.0717, 0.0717, 0.0]. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Within the sketch, create two concentric circles, denoted as circle\\_1 and circle\\_2, with the following properties: * Circle 1: + Center: [0.3033, 0.3033] + Radius: 0.3033 * Circle 2: + Center: [0.3033, 0.3033] + Radius: 0.2757 Each circle forms a separate face in the sketch: face\\_1 consists of circle\\_1. The object we are creating is a simple, hollow, circular ring with a flat inner surface. Now, scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.6066 using the `sketch_scale` parameter. This will create a scaled 2D sketch. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model, using an extrusion depth of 0.0476 along the positive Z-axis. The negative direction depth should be 0.0 to keep the other side flat.</description>
